reasoning: Reporting incidence (new diagnoses). Seminoma accounts for ~50% of testicular cancer cases. With testicular cancer incidence at ~5-6 per 100k men globally (~2.5-3 per 100k total population), seminoma is ~2.5 per 100k.
source: McGlynn KA et al. (2005). Trends in the incidence of testicular germ cell tumors in the United States. Cancer. 97(1):63-70
